Hey there, data enthusiasts! Feast your eyes on the visualizations meticulously crafted by yours truly. This spectacle unfolds every week as part of the [#TidyTuesday](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/tree/master#about-tidytuesday) Movement, a data-driven extravaganza ignited by the blazing passion of the [R4DS Online Learning Community](https://rfordatasci.com/). We're not just talking about any data; we're talking about real-world [datasets](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/tree/master#2018--2019--2020---2021--2022--2023) that pack a punch and make learning to dance with data a riveting experience.

But wait, there's more! Before you dive headfirst into this visual feast, I've laid out the secrets behind the magic -- the code, the portal to the dataset, and a description.

Welcome to the future of visual storytelling -- where data meets design in a symphony of awe-inspiring graphics. Let the adventure begin! ðŸš€ðŸ“Šâœ¨

## Week 14: Du Bois Visualization Challenge 2024

This week is organized around the colors of the [Pan African Flag](#0). We reproduce [plate 37](https://github.com/ajstarks/dubois-data-portraits/blob/master/challenge/2024/challenge10/original-plate-37.jpg), "A Series Of Statistical Charts Illustrating The Conditions Of Descendants Of Formal African Slaves Now Resident In The Unites States." \| [Data](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ajstarks/dubois-data-portraits/master/challenge/2024/challenge10/data.csv) \| Tools Used: Code + [Inkscape](https://inkscape.org/) + [Powerpoint](https://github.com/Aditya-Dahiya/projects_presentations/blob/main/docs/DuBois%20Challenge.pptx)

![](/docs/tidy_dubois.png)
